skill.name: project-operator
skill.description: Operates and debugs the local stack (API/worker/frontend); focuses on observability, logs, and safe automation.
skill.summary: Operates and debugs the local stack (API/worker/frontend); focuses on observability, logs, and safe ...
skill.author: ACSKamloops

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-only skill with no executable code. The SKILL.md file contains operational guidance for debugging and monitoring local development environments. No network calls, filesystem access, or external commands are present.

content.value_statement: Debugging distributed local stacks can be chaotic with unclear error sources and risky restarts. This skill provides structured observability practices, log-focused debugging, and safe automation patterns for API, worker, and frontend components.
actual_capabilities: Diagnose issues across API, worker, and frontend components
Tail and analyze logs from multiple services
Check service status and health endpoints safely
Apply incremental changes with revert strategies
Provide stop/cancel strategies for long-running commands
Explain configuration changes in plain language
limitations: Does not execute code or restart services automatically
Does not access remote production environments
Does not modify system files or configurations outside the project

use_cases.title: Debug distributed systems
use_cases.description: Trace errors across API, worker, and frontend layers using structured log analysis and health checks.

use_cases.title: Monitor local services
use_cases.description: Check service status, tail logs, and apply changes safely with clear rollback procedures.

use_cases.title: Reproduce and isolate issues
use_cases.description: Follow incremental debugging steps and use observability tools to isolate root causes.

prompt_templates.title: Check service health
prompt_templates.scenario: Verify all stack components are running
prompt_templates.prompt: Check the health of all services in my local stack. Identify any that are down or showing errors. Report status for each component.

prompt_templates.title: Tail and analyze logs
prompt_templates.prompt: Tail the logs for my local stack. Look for error patterns and identify the most recent issues across all services.

prompt_templates.title: Safe configuration change
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to update my configuration. Explain the impact of the change and provide a revert path in case something goes wrong.

prompt_templates.title: Debug long-running operation
prompt_templates.prompt: I started a long-running command and it seems stuck. Check the status and provide a strategy to stop or cancel it safely.

output_examples.input: Check the health of all my local services
output: Frontend service: Error - Connection refused on port 3000
Recommendation: Check frontend logs for startup errors

best_practices: Read logs before restarting any service to understand the root cause
Make incremental changes so each change is observable and can be reverted
Always ask for a revert strategy before applying configuration changes
anti_patterns: Restarting services without first reading logs or checking error messages
Making large, sweeping changes without a rollback plan
Running long commands without knowing how to stop them

faq.question: Does this skill restart services automatically?
faq.answer: No. The skill focuses on observability and safe automation patterns. It will advise on restart strategies but never execute them without explicit instruction.

faq.question: Can I use this with production environments?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for local development stacks. Production debugging requires different safety protocols and access controls.

faq.question: What stack components are supported?
faq.answer: The skill works with API, worker, and frontend components. It focuses on reading logs, checking status, and providing guidance.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill. It reads logs and status information from your local stack but does not transmit data externally.

faq.question: Why are my services not starting?
faq.answer: Check the logs first. Common issues include port conflicts, missing environment variables, or configuration errors. The skill can help analyze logs.

faq.question: How is this different from general debugging tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured debugging workflows specifically for distributed local stacks with emphasis on safe, observable changes.
